intro: Tocoyena stipulosa, commonly known as the silverleaf tocoyena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking silver-green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite and have a distinctive stipule at the base, which is a key identifying feature. Tocoyena stipulosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
